alert.note: Alert for Inland Volusia; Northern Lake County; Orange; Seminole (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 02 at 3:00PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Seminole, east central Lake, northwestern Orange and southwestern Volusia Counties through 330 PM EDT... At 300 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Wekiva Springs, or near Lake Mary, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Deltona, Sanford, Winter Springs, Lake Mary and Longwood. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or hard-topped vehicle. Remember, when thunder roars, go indoors! A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 700 PM EDT for east central Florida.

area.areaDesc: Inland Volusia; Northern Lake County; Orange; Seminole
